Package mklab.JGNN.adhoc.train

Class SampleClassification

java.lang.Object
mklab.JGNN.adhoc.ModelTraining
mklab.JGNN.adhoc.train.SampleClassification
public class SampleClassification extends ModelTraining
Extends the ModelTraining class to train Model instances from feature and label matrices. This is a generic classification scheme that also supports (and follows the training data flow of) traditional neural networks that can produce batch predictions. If the model is a GNN, it is assumed that it contains the graph adjacency matrix and the node features as constants, and its input are node identifiers. This scheme is automated under FastBuilder.classify(). In this case, classification features should be an identity vertical matrix of node identifiers; in the simplest case a vertical matrix organization of [0,1,2,3,4,...]. Labels should be a matrix with predictions for corresponding rows. Batch data generators create only one instance of data for each batch, where the instance contains data for all trained or validated nodes.
Author:
Emmanouil Krasanakis
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • setFeatures

      public SampleClassification setFeatures(Matrix features)
      Sets the feature matrix of data samples, where each row corresponds to a different sample. Features and labels should have the same number of rows.
      Parameters:
      features - The feature matrix.
      Returns:
      this classification training instance.

    • setOutputs

      public SampleClassification setOutputs(Matrix labels)
      Sets the label matrix of data samples, where each row corresponds to a different sample. For example, each row may be an one-hot encoding of the respective sample's class when accessed. Features and labels should have the same number of rows.
      Parameters:
      labels - The label matrix.
      Returns:
      this classification training instance.

    • setTrainingSamples

      public SampleClassification setTrainingSamples(Slice trainingSamples)
      Sets a slice of training samples. These should be identifiers of feature/label rows; basically, they reflect which rows of these matrices should be retrieved during training. If multiple batches are set, for example with ModelTraining.setNumBatches(int), then these samples are further split for each batch.
      Parameters:
      trainingSamples - The slice of training samples.
      Returns:
      this classification training instance.

    • setValidationSamples

      public SampleClassification setValidationSamples(Slice validationSamples)
      Sets a slice of validation samples. These should be identifiers of feature/label rows; basically, they reflect which rows of these matrices should be retrieved during validation.
      Parameters:
      validationSamples - The slice of validation samples.
      Returns:
      this classification training instance.

    • onStartEpoch

      protected void onStartEpoch(int epoch)
      Description copied from class: ModelTraining
      Performs necessary training operations at the beginning of each epoch. These typically consist of dataset shuffling if ModelTraining.setParallelizedStochasticGradientDescent(boolean) is enabled.
      Specified by:
      onStartEpoch in class ModelTraining
      Parameters:
      epoch - The epoch that now starts. Takes values 0,1,2,...,epochs-1, though early stopping may not reach the maximum number.

    • getBatchData

      protected List<BatchData> getBatchData(int batch, int epoch)
      Description copied from class: ModelTraining
      Returns a list BatchData instance to be used for a specific batch and training epoch. This list may have only one entry if the whole batch can be organized into one pair of model inputs-outputs (e.g., in node classification). This method is overloaded by classes extending ModelTraining to let them work as dataset loaders. Batch data may be created anew each time, though they are often transparent views of parts of training data. Batch data generation may be parallelized, depending on the whether ModelTraining.setParallelizedStochasticGradientDescent(boolean) is enabled. If some operations (e.g., data shuffling) take place at the beginning of each epoch, they instead reside in the #startEpoch() method.
      Specified by:
      getBatchData in class ModelTraining
      Parameters:
      batch - The batch identifier. Takes values 0,1,2,..,numBatches-1.
      epoch - The epoch in which the batch is extracted. Takes values 0,1,2,...,epochs-1, though early stopping may not reach the maximum number.
      Returns:
      An list of batch data instances.

    • getValidationData

      protected List<BatchData> getValidationData(int epoch)
      Description copied from class: ModelTraining
      Returns a BatchData instance to be used for validation at a given training epoch. This list may have only one entry if the whole batch can be organized into one pair of model inputs-outputs (e.g., in node classification). This method is overloaded by classes extending ModelTraining to let them work as dataset loaders. Batch data may be created anew each time, though they are often transparent views of parts of training data.
      Specified by:
      getValidationData in class ModelTraining
      Parameters:
      epoch - The epoch in which the batch is extracted. Takes values 0,1,2,...,epochs-1, though early stopping may not reach the maximum number.
      Returns:
      An list of batch data instances.
